definition: genre of song-and-dance duet popular in northeast China
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: If you are comfortable with that, then you can decree whatever you want to decree .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是滿意的，二人轉，那麼你可以令你想做法令。

sentences.english: Heishan county is the cradle of Errenzhuan, which has more than two hundred years of history.
sentences.chinese: 黑山縣是二人轉的發祥地，有着二百多年的歷史。

sentences.english: The essential characteristics of Couple Dance Opera is the carnival of the common people.
sentences.chinese: 二人轉的本質特徵是平民的狂歡性。

sentences.english: I am just an ordinary actor.
sentences.chinese: 我只是一個普通的二人轉演員。

sentences.english: Song- and- Dance Duet is a civil art in northeast which farmers like it deeply.
sentences.chinese: 二人轉是深受東北農民喜愛的一種民間藝術。

sentences.english: Song- and- Dance Duet is a civil art of Northeast where farmers like it deeply.
sentences.chinese: 二人轉是深受東北農民喜愛的一種民間藝術。

sentences.english: The second chapter examines the cultural characteristics of song and dance duet.
sentences.chinese: 第二章則考察了二人轉的文化特徵。

sentences.english: The art of singing is one main means to attract and infect the audience.
sentences.chinese: “唱功”是二人轉藝術感染觀衆的主要手段。

sentences.english: I am just an ordinary actor of "two person act".
sentences.chinese: 我只是一個普通的二人轉演員。

sentences.english: The Global Times article also pointed to criticism of a cross-dressing comedian, Xiao Shenyang.
sentences.chinese: 《環球時報》的文章也對小瀋陽的二人轉提出了批評。

sentences.english: The er ren zhuan, or two-person skit, has gained in popularly among the Chinese recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近，二人轉已爲中國老百姓所喜聞樂見。

definition: a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
a drum-shaped rattle (used by peddlers or as a toy)/rattle-drum
to make a fool of oneself
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
